docs.lead_paragraph: As more drugs are found to be problematic for women, the National Institutes of Health is seeking inclusion of female lab animals from the earliest stages of research.

headline.main: Labs Are Told to Start Including a Neglected Variable: Females
headline.print_headline: Labs Are Told to Start Including a Neglected Variable: Females

docs.abstract: National Institutes of Health is directing scientists to perform their experiments with both female and male animals, part of increased effort to end gender bias in basic research as more drugs are found to be problematic for women; researchers have avoided using female animals in tests for fear that some bodily functions could affect experiments; NIH commentary is published in journal Nature.
docs.snippet: As more drugs are found to be problematic for women, the National Institutes of Health is seeking inclusion of female lab animals from the earliest stages of research.
